item.title: Bahá’í Faith
item.description: Introduction For the Bahá’í Faith, there is only one deity, and it is responsible for the creation, maintenance, and dissolution of the world. They call this deity Bahá. Bahá is a personal deity, who is aware of the activities of the world, and sends messengers and prophets to communicate on its behalf. Of particular note is that Bahá’ís consider many religious figures from other traditions to be legitimate representatives of Bahá - for example Jesus, Muhammad, and Gautama Buddha.
